page.title: 14SEASHORE AT THE WITTERINGS
page.content: The higher part of the beach at East Wittering is covered with shingle up to the low sea wall.It is divided into segments by groynes,which act as a sea defence,breaking up the force of the incoming waves.As the tide recedes a flat sandy beach is revealed.Looking out to sea you can see The Nab Tower, an old Martello Tower,and the Northern shore of the Isle of Wight. People walk along the foreshore throughout the year,but during the Summer months visitors throng to the Witterings and Bracklesham beaches. Attractions include safe swimming, sand,sailing,surfing and wind surfing. The local coastguard are constantly alert during this time and often have to contact the rescue services when sailors or wind surfers run into difficulty.The beaches are also scanned by air/sea resuce services.
